caption: If you've got a preference for East coast pizza this place is one of the best in Chicago
Def going to be ordering again from here. Good pizza dough and fresh ingredients made for a pizza the whole family enjoyed.
Pizza different from most places, but very good. Meatballs and salad very good, only disappointment was desert.
A Friday night favorite!!  Great pizza.  Fast and always friendly.  Great specials (when serving in).  Appreciate the extra mile they go during Covid.
Awesome food and service. Great customer service on the phone.
Our go-to pizza

Very solid pie! Got a large pepp for takeout. Flat crust, delicious red sauce, thick cheese. Reminds me of the pizza in Long Island. Not as thin as New Haven. Also important to note, excellent customer service. Very friendly over the phone and in person, and because my pie was delayed and I was waiting inside the manager offered me a soda on the house. Would love to visit in person when the time comes.
Great pizza & service. Carry out is easy and fast, too!
Pizza is decent if you can ever get it hot. Delivery and service consistently poor.
Superb thin crust pizza

[COVID pickup review] Overall: A solid takeout option for those looking for a good deal while going above the standard chain options.  The good: Pickup was right on time and provided friendly service. The portions are well-sized, we had plenty of leftovers (we got a large w/ garlic sticks and baked cheese). Everything was exactly as you would expect - the garlic sticks were garlicy, and the pizza was cooked well with plenty of sauce and cheese.  The not-so-good: The flavors didn't really blow us out of the water, and the baked cheese appetizer was lacking. Maybe it was just because it was takeout, but there was only a dollop of (semi-solid) cheese swimming in a lake of marinara. It fit the needs, but we expected better.

Pizza Serio has delicious pizza and even better cheesy flatbread. But, I specifically want to highlight their customer service. They are always kind thoughtful, quick, kind and attentive. Thank you Pizza Serio for being a solid dinner option on the area.
Best Margherita pizza in Chicago
Awesome PIzza!
I really like their brick oven pizzas, their bread is so good, it makes the pizzas, I think I could just eat it without any toppings! Nice beer selection too, make sure to tell Tom hello.

We had to try the pizza here, and the dough is incredible. Something on our pizza was too salty though. I craved the chicken liver on toast which was their bruschetta but it had an after taste. Too much liver on each slice, and had a bitterness to it. Sadly disappointed with this one. The best dish is the warm octopus salad. Perfect combination of lemon and saltiness brine from the octopus. This is a dish that we’d go back to the restaurant for!

There's lots of different types of pizza in Chicago. Deep dish, pub style, calzones. But I have yet to have a better NY style pizza in Chicago than at Pizzeria Serio*. The crust is great, the specialty pies are well crafted with interesting mixes of toppings, and it's only a 15 min walk from my apartment. Love this restaurant. Hope you guys make it through this. I'll definitely be ordering more delivery until then.  *I have only lived in Chicago for one year at time of writing.
Great prices
This place was definitely monumental and fascinating!!!
the design was monumental and the taste of the pizza was fascinating! delicious!
monumental and fascinating
Monumental food, very fascinating atmosphere
Really good pizza joint love the fact that the mushrooms are fresh and not canned that’s an A+++ on my book.
Pretty good pizza. The sweet heat was great and that cheese pizza was killer.

We stumbled across Serio's on our way home to the burbs and DANG!  We were so happy we did!  Excellent pizza with a great flavored crust and a great beer selection.  We ordered the daily chef special, which had roasted garlic, cauliflower, with a garlic sauce....so tasty!  The goat cheese app was AMAZING!  Seriously, don't even think twice about going there...just do it!
Recommend Diavola and Sweet Heat. Friendly staff and quick service.

username: The Body Whisperer - La Monica Brooks

caption: Great thin crust. Good atmosphere
Sausage, thin crust & drizzled with honey. So. Good. Definitely a pizza I will travel for
Decent pizza.  Close to a NY pie as you’ll get in Chicago
Some of the best thin crust in the city, if you're into that kind of thing.
Best New York style pizza I've had in Chicago. The spicy pies are particularly good!
The Staff and the food are EXCELLENT! We had a terrific time. Thank you!

I love this place! Great beer selection and excellent pizza. The Maplewood Juice Pants is one of my favorites. The staff is super friendly and attentive. I didn't get a picture of our pizza because we dug in too fast, but here are the two great salads we ordered. Most certainly will return to Pizzeria Serio!
Best pizza in Chicago. Friendly staff and great specials.
I've had many bad pizzas in Chicago, and this was not one of them. I came in on a slow weekend and got a small pizza for two. It was filling and delicious. Would stop by again, or maybe get takeout.
Very friendly staff and the pizza's really very good. It's affordable and it has a nice trendy atmosphere, but still remains relatively family friendly.
Celebrated my nephews birthday it was a lot of fun!

If you've never tried the pizza from Pizzeria Serio you are missing out. Good rotating choice of craft beer on tab. Service can be busy at time but stay professional and friendly. Eat in, pick up or delivery.....same taste.
This is my favorite pizza in Chicago! Try the Sweet Heat Pizza!
Great pizza great service Thank u
Great wood oven pizza
Traditional pizza with crust perfectly light, crispy, and chewy, all at the same time.  Great apps and fancier pizza options too
Really enjoyed the margarita pizza. Authentic oven fired taste. Also good selection of beer, friendly service, and and TVs to watch the game on.

Top to bottom best pizza joint in Lakeview/ Roscoe village! Great beer and wine selection,  fantastic service and scrumptious brick oven pizza! The pizza crust is like a the outside of a loaf of freshly baked French bread.  If you try the pizza you absolutely must eat it there. While it's still delicious, traveling hurts the crust a bit .
One of the best pizza places in Chicago.
Good food, good beers, good service!

Solid pizza at a good price. Definitely a "family" atmosphere but okay draft list with some good craft beer and unique pizza style you can't really find anywhere else in the city. It's worth checking out at least once and like myself if you go once you'll probably find yourself going back again and again

My husband and I ordered a pizza for the first time this evening and this is the only time I’ve ever seen my husband refuse to eat pizza. His exact words were this is ketchup on a cracker. I tasted the pizza as well: bland, no flavor, raw green peppers, no cheese. Pretty awful. Looked like such a cute spot. Fire the chefs or change your receipe is our recommendation.
Nice ,open and friendly place, good food
great pizza.very well done. prob the best in chicago

Favorite pizza place in Chicago, good family place, very hip and vibrant. Great pizza, just wish the crust was a bit thicker, but it doesn't diminish the quality. Make it a stop before a night out or your main place for an event, never disappoints.

What else is there to say about this place that hasn't already been said? This is the greatest pizza I've ever had as far as I'm concerned. The crust is out of this world - and I didn't even know I cared about crust! If you're in the mood for a delicious local pizza spot, this is for you!
Loved everything about this pizzeria. Pizza was delicious, great beer selection and the ambiance was just what we were looking for.
Always delicious pizza, good beer selection as well.
Eas there for a private event.  Pizza and other food was good.
Our go-to local joint for brick oven pizza.  It's a great place to bring the family AND have a beer!
Great oizza
Never had bad service here and the pizza is always, always so good.
Simple but excellent neighborhood pizza!

Took a pizza tour and this was on one of the stops. We had a slice of their sweet and spicy pizza. (not sure of the exact name) I was pretty skeptical at first because of the honey. I am also a picky eater. Let me tell you this pizza was FIRE. (not spicy just dank) I would definitely come back when visiting Chicago.
Great pizza place good ingredients and atmosphere.

The pizza is not bad and the drinks are average in price. The service was also good, but the place was empty. It's not a go to place anymore as it used to be a long time ago. So if your looking for a quiet place to eat and have a drink, this is it.
Solid wood fired pizza!
Sundays Family Day, kids eat free!!!!
Best pizza and calzones! Also top notch marinara, they should sell it!
As a NYer in Chicago, this is the closest to NYC pizza as it gets. And it’s good! Goat cheese app is bangin!
Incredible pizza, great atmosphere
Always delicious! Sauce is flavorful and crust is perfectly done.  Baked goat cheese appetizer is a must
Pretty good pizza. Just solid all around. Toppings, cheese, sauce, crust. All good. Price is reasonable. Delivery was fast.
The best.
Love the brick oven pizza, really nice place.
The beers are delicious and the pizzas homemade
Reminds Me Of The Pizza In Montreal, I Love It!!!

Arranging a Rehearsal Dinner from a distance was a challenge, but Scott Toth at Pizzeria Serio made it easy and stress free.  The upstairs event venue was exactly what was wanted by the bride and groom; laid back, no-fuss, and fun.  We were able to show our slide show on all TVs, so it was enjoyed by all no matter where they were in the room. The staff was amazing and very prompt.  The buffet choices were great and the delicious pizza kept coming!  Thank you for a wonderful evening!

If you are me (from the southeast and hate Chicago pizza), this is the place for you.   FINALLY,  I have a go to place for pizza after 3 years of living here.  If you know Mellow Mushroom, then this is where you want to eat.  Good service, great pizza.
My only one favorite pizzeria with bar... so so so delicious and kind staff.

Pizzeria Serio is one of our favorite places in Lakeview! We've been going for years, and the staff is friendly, the specials are great, and it's a fantastic neighborhood spot away from the hustle of central Lakeview and Wrigley.
Excellent collection of rotating beers. Really good pizza. Get the garlic sticks!
Good pizza and staff is friendly, although Simpsons trivia is the real reason to come here.

When it comes down to it, pizza is probably one of the most important elements to the American society. Yes, it probably started in Italy, and definitely mocked around the world, but this place is "Serio"us about their quality. They are thoroughly consistent, and on time with their deliveries. The pizza arrives fresh out the oven and their customer first service is what is to be expected and I hope it stays that way.
Pizza was so-so...it gets a fourth star because Serio has Simpsons trivia every third Monday of the month.
Yummy
Best pizza around!
Excellent!

We live a few blocks away and have been wanting to try serio.  We had no expectations going in but the food and service was fantastic. The food came out fast and the thin crust in the bread was probably one one the best thin crusts I have ever had.  Serio is now our go to pizza place.
Best pizza in town! And fantastic service, always.
Food and service was great
Enjoying Pizza there
Great brick oven pizza! And my son loved it there too which is a hard find! So all around good vibes!
I've only ever been for the wonderful monthly Simpsons trivia event, but the pizza's always tasty, the beer selection solid, and the staff friendly.
Great pizza and good beer. This was a fabulous neighborhood find. I tried the sweet heat pizza and loved the touch of honey.
great pizza with a wide selection of beer. only issue is the taps could be colder for some of the pours.
Sweet heat!!!!!
Very good....visited on a busy Friday.  A bit chaotic...but pizza was wonderful
Great pizza!
This place rocks!
Meatball sub was glorious. Good beer selection. Staff was very friendly.
Came here for a school event for my son. It was very well run. Good drink selection. My son liked the pizza.

That kind of pizza that gets better as you get though a slice. The kind that, even though you want to leave room for Scooter's custard, you can't because that crust is too good. It was delicious and was great for our night with our vegan friends that could thoroughly enjoy the pizza because it's not about the cheese, or the meat, its about that really freaking good crust. Way to go serio!
Their pizza was great!! Service was good and they also had a really good beer list.
Love the za! Great bar staff.
Pizza is great and they have a great beer selection.

I came here for a birthday party and really enjoyed the food.  We only tried the pizza, but they have a nice selection and it comes out quickly.  During the week they have great food and drink specials so check it out sometime.
Awesome bar

Loved it! Great Napolitan pizza and yummy Nutella dessert! We got a pizza Margareta and a Diavola (one was half price because it was Tuesday!) and they were both fantastic, fresh ingredients and a nice balance of flavors. For dessert we got the Nutella baked in pizza dough and that was a wonderful treat at the end of the meal. We brought our 9 month old daughter and they were great with accommodating her and she really enjoyed herself.
Great pizza, beer and atmosphere!
This is my number spot for pizza in the city.  Perfect brick oven pizza at a very reasonable price.  Always solid beer and whiskey choices too.

Great Pizza, servers are very nice, they are not the most attentive staff I have ever seen, but they are nice... This is not a "kids restaurant" at all, but they do seem to care about families, you don't feel like they whish you weren't there with you 3 little monsters. Im usually there on Sunday, kids eat free from the kids menu Good beer selection, Not a whole lot on the menu, but thats actually good, because what they do have us good and it comes out pretty quick, that's Very important when you have kids and since the food comes out quick, the kids dont get bored of waiting,they also have several "booths" which us another great thing for a family place. Don't think they have a parking lot, but street parking is easy to find. Overall a Very good place, especially for families, my kids love it. Will be coming back again.
Their brick oven pizza is the best, everything is always good and fresh, super friendly people, so happy we found Serio!
One of the best North side pizza places. It serves a personal size pie that's just right for one, with a great menu selection.
$15 all you can eat pizza? Hell to the yeah. It was also in abundance, and very tasty.

As an exiled New Yorker who is a complete snob about pizza, Pizzeria Serio is one of the few places in Chicago that serves a pie in the true New York style. No cracker crusts here and thank the Lord they will only do a pie cut.  (I have never understood the concept of cutting a round pie into a bunch of tiny little squares!) New Yorkers always argue about whether a chewy crust or crunchy crust is the best crust. While I prefer a crunchy crust, the chewy crust at Serio still reminds me of home. (But if you throw a slice in a frying pan or on a pizza stone the next day, it crisps up perfectly!) A number of their specialty pies are particularly good. Spice fiends will love the Diablo. Meat fiends will love the Meat Your Heart Out. If you choose to dine in, it's a very comfortable neighborhood spot to nip in for a quick bite and a couple pints.

We love Pizza Serio. We always get the Chef's Special. Sometimes the combo sounds weird but it is always delicious. These guys make good pizza. And they have a friendly waitstaff. And a great rotating beer selection.
Not handicapped accessible.
Good food good service excellent overall 😋
Great staff, good food and awesome weekly deals. Recomend for dine in
pizza restaurant and more! a favorite of mine!!
Simpsons Trivia embiggens the experience of great pizza!
Great atmosphere and good pizza!
Great place to eat wood fire grill pizza..
It was wonderful and Sarah was simply the best!
Great breakfast pizza.
Their pizza is MARVELOUS
Didn't care for the pizza
The best gluten free crust I've ever had!!
Great beer selection. Brick oven pizza is delicious!
Great food and staff
Good pizza, decent beer selection
Food was good.  A little bit pricey. Finding parking can be difficult.
Great pie.
Best GF/DF breakfast pizza!  And complimentary fresh made cinnamon rolls with brunch! French toast sticks with berries, mmmmm
Incredible pizza! Several days later and I'm still thinking about it.
Great pizza but the sandwiches should not be overlooked either.
Great job with our private party! Pizza was awesome!
Great service and very good food - not just pizza. Great for kids as well.
good pizza and beer.  friendly staff and a good atmosphere
Good pizza.  Good service.
I've eaten pizza all around the city, this is one of the best. Great beer selection. Also steps away from Scooter's, so during the summer you can go pizza to ice cream.
Best pizza anywhere!
Reasonably priced good tasty Pizzas
Great beer list and creative pizza
Love the diavola pizza here
Unique pizzas of good quality
Best place for brick oven pizza in Lakeview. Cozy place with great appetizers.
Nice little place, friendly staff
Very good pizza.  Highly recommended.
Great pizza.  Awesome service!
Love the coal fired pizza!!  Ingredients are fresh and tasty.
Lots of unique choices for pizza, and pretty good for thin crust.

I recently used their private room for a surprise party I was hosting. It could not have turned out more wonderful. We had a very friendly bartender, Travis, and the party coordinator Sarah, was always on top of her game. I must have asked 100 questions, via email, the day of the party and she answered within a few minutes each time.  Food was great, as always. Everyone commented on how much they loved the thin crust. No room reservation fee and I was offered a discount of 10% if I paid in cash which I happily accepted.  Great place for a party! Highly recommend to use Pizzeria Serio!
best damn pizza and meat balls in all of chicagoland, great atmosphere and friendly staff.  love the owner "big daddy pizza dude" Steve.......... the pirateboy ;)
Surprisingly kid friendly and healthy.
In a city of great pizza, this is a standout. Great pizza!
Lovely environment great food

SATURDAY BRUNCH! I was a little bit sketchy  about brunch from a pizza parlor but was pleasantly surprised. The complimentary cinnamom role was a great starter, and the breakfast pizza (mexicana) was actually great! Also the mimosas tasted great (he didnt skimp out on the special ingredient!!alcohol). Very good also got to watch the bears game.
AMAZING.  Fresh toppings, reasonably priced pizza and unique draft list! Will be back ASAP!

Consistently excellent pizza and calzones.  Crust is not gimmicky (not that there's anything wrong if that's your sort of thing, they just don't do it at Serio), just straightforward and tasty.  Good as salads as well. Fantastic marinara and meatballs.  Always a decent beer selection.  Staff is always friendly and will take good care of you.   Appreciate the new menu and it's great to see that Sweet Heat made the cut!  Is short, a solid standby that I'm fortunate and proud to have in the neighborhood.
Great pizza and good beer selection!
Great food, very fast service.
Phenomenal spinach dip, and I enjoy the craft beer selections!
Really good pizza

If you are looking for "pizza" with crust that tastes just like Chucky Cheese then this is the place for you. If you are looking for bruschetta that has no mozzarella or pizza not worth saving the immense amount of left overs then here you go. By the way turn in your chicago card at the door.
In my opinion, the best pizza in Chicago. And a good beer selection also, draft and bottle. (And tallboy).
Great brick oven pizza.
Bartender Michael was very friendly and helpful in drink selections and food orders. Great monthly beer focuses and food specials
Great pie, good drink specials, friendly staff and owners too.

Beware of black crunchy bits on the pizza.  I guess it's build up from the oven, burned into basically charcoal, that flaked off?  Anyway, it made rather offputting crunching sounds.  One of my teeth felt kind of weird and I hoped that it was simply some grime got caked on during the meal... nope.  My tooth is slightly chipped.  I didn't even realize that was possible.
Good pizza. Great menu
The special for Thursday is very misleading. Plenty of better places with honest marketing.

I was underwhelmed by the pizza I picked up here and took home to eat. Not quite the more authentic Italian version that you get at Frasca - Serio is somewhere in between American and Italian pizza. That's not necessarily a bad thing and the quantity of good reviews will probably be enough to get me to come back in and try dining in. Mine may has been sitting around a while as it wasn't piping hot and tasted a bit rubbery.
Very good pizza for this part of the city. Good service and the second story bar is great for sports and groups.  I havent had a bad pizza here.

I love this place. Thin crust, brick-oven pizza? Yes please!!! It's a great place to take a date in my opinion. The interior is intimate, yet modern. Oh and the pizza is delicious whether you eat there or order for carryout.
Amazing pizza, great atmosphere. Ill be coming here very often!
To go phone service is fantasic! I always get any medium pizza and the freshness of their pizza is why I always go back to them. And being in lakeview, very resonably priced.
brick oven pizza that's also a great place to watch games at.

Love having Pizzeria Serio around the block from us.   Always a good choice when we are craving thin pizza. We always get the margherita con carne and their caesar salad is also good.   Service is always friendly and quick, whether you are dining in or picking up.
The pizza looked good.  The upstairs spot was really chill.  Excellent for any party.
Serio Pizza is my north side alternative to Coal Fire pizza.  Very good pie and very quick service along with awesome specials during the week.  I would highly recommend stopping by on a Tuesday.

Finally a pizza place that isn't afraid to add some flavor to their pizza!...and can make a thin crust crisp that can hold the ingredients and not get soggy and floppy.  Stopped in while visiting Chicago based on a friends recommendation after an early play w/ 12 of us.  Wife liked the artichoke dip, artichokes aren't my thing, we all loved the baked goat cheese marinara and the basil pesto flatbread.  The Diavolo pizza was awesome...crisp crust, hearty topping and just the right amount of heat from the sopressata.  If spice isn't your thing the Margherita was nice and fresh tasting...one of my kids even liked it better than the cheese pizza...which is saying a lot!  The kids also liked watching the pizza dough being tossed and put in the oven.  Atmosphere-wise it is solid...brick loft like walls, nice bar, you can see the brick oven and our group sat by the front window which was open to the street (Belmont).  Only thing missing was dessert, but with 3 kids we rarely order dessert out anymore....plus restaurant portions are usually so big we don't have room anyway.  Really enjoyed the pizza, with all the pizza joints around you would think it would but easy to find good pizza, but most are just average, this one is definitely not.
I placed an order for pick-up, pizza was ready when promised. One problem, pizza was not good. If you are looking for good brick-oven pizza, take a walk East to Saporri de Nappoli.
